multiple_choice_question.text: What is catastrophic forgetting in the context of neural networks?
choices: The tendency of a network to overfit training data and perform poorly on unseen data.
The inability of a network to learn new information after being trained on a specific task.
The phenomenon where a network forgets previously learned information when learning new information.
The loss of trained weights in a network due to hardware failure or software errors.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does pseudorehearsal address the problem of catastrophic forgetting?
choices: By retraining the network on the entire dataset after learning each new piece of information.
By increasing the complexity of the network architecture to accommodate new information.
By generating artificial data that resemble previously learned information and using it during training.
By using regularization techniques to prevent the network weights from changing drastically.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the median value of an agent\'s performance across multiple runs indicate?
choices: The average performance of the agent across all runs.
The variability in the agent\'s performance across runs.
The agent\'s resistance to catastrophic forgetting, with higher values indicating better resistance.
The time taken by the agent to complete the task in each run.
